intro: Cryptocarya subbullata, commonly known as the hairy cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the coastal regions of New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with glossy, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, whitish hairs. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, followed by spherical, woody fruits. Cryptocarya subbullata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
